headline: Vegan Brownies
description: These vegan brownies are gooey, fudgy, and rich with chocolate flavor. These easy-to-make treats are the best homemade egg-free, dairy-free brownies.

video.description: A great chocolate dessert for people who avoid dairy and eggs.
video.name: Vegan Brownies

name: Vegan Brownies

recipeInstructions.text: Preheat the oven to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C). Grease a 9x13-inch baking dish.
Stir together flour, sugar, cocoa powder, baking powder, and salt in a large bowl. Pour in water, vegetable oil, and vanilla; mix until well-blended. Spread evenly in the prepared dish.
Bake in the preheated oven until top is no longer shiny, 25 to 30 minutes. Let cool for at least 10 minutes before cutting into 16 squares.

review.reviewBody: Amazing ! This has become my go-to brownie recipe every time and it turns out amazing always. Definitely would recommend!
I made per recipe , cutting sugar 1/8 cup and added walnuts and chocolate chips! oMG! Best Brownie ever!!!!
Great recipe! I was the only one who needed vegan but everyone loved them. Cooked it for 30 minutes and came out perfectly - moist on the inside, dry on top.

Made these subbing out regular flour for Bobs 1-1 ratio Gluten Free Flour & adding vegan chocolate chips. I do wish the chocolate flavour was a little bit stronger but I will add more cocoa next time ! scooped them into muffin liners and naked 350 degrees on high fan for 12 minutes in my works ovens and they were perfect and gooey

These brownies are really yummy. They happen to be a little cakey though. I followed the recipe except I added cinnamon used milk instead of water and I did as another commenter said, about using 1/4 cup of oil and 3/4 cup of applesauce. They are extremely moist, which is perfect because I love moist cupcakes. I even added powdered sugar on top. I did think that the mix was a little liquify for brownies after mixing, so I ended up adding more flower, which might have been why they ended up a little cakey. It’s definitely a recipe I’ll play with a little. I’ve been craving vegan sweets!

Ive been making this version for years and it never gets old!!! I actually put 1 cup of sugar ( instead of 2) to make it diabetic friendly for friends and family. I also like to add a little more choc powder. Instead of icing, I like to add no/low sugar peanut butter. The texture is perfect ✨
The brownies came out really well. Only one question, do the brownies turn gooey while chewing ?

These brownies were delicious and moist! I too tweaked it a little. I used coffee vs water, oil and unsweetened applesauce (1/4 cup oil and 1/2 cup applesauce) and i used a little less sugar because I don't like brownies to be too sweet. Overall, this is a really good quick recipe , especially when you have a taste fir a brownie or anything sweet. This recipe definitely satisfies that craving and hits the spot. Hope this helps!
Followed the recipe and these are not good at all. Baker beware! Go find another recipe!
I loved it. I replaced the vegetable oil with coconut oil and added some vegan chocolate chips and it was AMAZING!

I made this and I followed the recipe to the exact measurements, degrees, and timing. So tell me why when I put my brownies in the oven and came back to check on them, they were boiling. now I wasted all of that time and broke several promises saying that I would provide vegan brownies for Christmas.
Really oily! the taste was amazing, but i believe i cooked it in the top rack so the middle didn't cook properly, or the tooth pick got out clean because of the oil!
Made it exactly as the recipe directed. I use Dominican style vanilla that adds a nice flavor and dark cocoa powder. Yum!

The brownie was too oily and tasted like bad brownie from a gas station. A person will definitely have made a major adjustment to make these brownies toleratable. But this recipe is great to start experimenting with such as adding less oil and more cocoa power, etc, etc for any young baker wanting to learn from their mistakes.
I’m vegan and my husband is not. He LOVES brownies and these are his favorite. They are delicious!

i literally made this account just to leave this review. i don't know what is up with this recipe but I made it and baked it for the recommended amount of time and it came out with a nice crispy top with pure liquid inside. please make any other brownie.
I changed the white flour to whole wheat organic flour, I used coconut sugar in stead of white sugar, I used coconut milk to replace the water, and i added chocolate chips.
yayayayayyay

i’ve made these brownies for years since becoming vegan. i’ve never had trouble with the recipe, its been a family favorite ! i’ve had people ask for the recipe and brought it to events just to return home with an empty pan
Amazing recipe, all time favorite for everyone that tried it! Vegans and non vegans loved it! Mom asks me to make it when we're having guests:P

My family and friends looove this recipe! It’s so easy to make However, we did make some changes to the recipe... We only add 1 cup of sugar and 1/3 cup of oil and they turn out perfect every single time!
amazing. You can't tell they are vegan

This is my go-to recipe for brownies! I cut all of the ingredients in half and add a teaspoon of chili pepper and three teaspoons of cinnamon and bake in a 9 by 9 pan. Wonderful every time! I find that using the unbleached flour helps keep the brownies from being a bit crumbly. So I'm sure to always use it. I'm so glad I found this perfect vegan brownie recipe!
So oily, but amazing brownies! Really only problem is there was a ton of oil... like a ton. but so yummy!

After making this, I think the ingredients are a bit off balance. There is a heavy amount of sugar and oil that could be avoided. The wet batter did taste great off of the spoon. Also, 350 for 25 minutes is not typical for baking brownies and at that point mine were a chocolate lava mess. Cooked at 350 for 35 minutes total and turned up to 400 for 10 more minutes. Theyre finally done. Would not recommend this particular recipe but a little adjustments could make it a solid go-to.
I made this recipe gluten free and it is so delicious. I used sparkling water instead of plain water because I do this with most baked good recipes and its perfect!
These came out amazing and taste great! Only subbed 2/3 cup applesauce and 1/3 cup oil for the full cup of oil.

I liked this recipe . It was a little hard to mix the water and oil with the dry ingredients , but other than that it was a total time saver . It only took me at least 45 minutes and it was vegan ! A great recipe over all . Hope this was helpful .
Crumbled immediately. They were unusable and the taste was a bit off. I followed the recipe to a ‘T’ and they were not good. They also had an aftertaste that stuck with me for a while.

My family loves these! They are not vegan, so on occasion I will add mint chocolate chips to them, or chocolate chips. They love them even without the chips added and ask me to make them on a regular basis.

This is my go to brownie recipe!! I absolutely love it! Sometimes I add dairy free chocolate chips or nuts but it's good as written!

You'd never know it's vegan if you didn't know. I've had so many requests for my recipe when I take these to a pot luck.
These brownies were perfect as a lot of my family members are vegan. They tasted really good however, they did fall apart quite a bit. I would recommend using a chia or flax seed egg in it as well

This was my first attempt at vegan brownies and my non-vegan family couldn't tell the difference!!! They're delicious. I subbed 1 cup of white sugar for brown sugar so had 1 cup of each, because I think it makes the flavor richer and the texture a little chewier which I prefer. These came out beautifully!!! I will definitely be making these again.

I have been making these brownies for years now. They are the best brownies I've ever experienced. These are truly foolproof crowd pleasers. The perfect consistency. Perfect flavour. I honestly cannot say enough good things about this recipe. I usually sub in vegan milk for the water (or sometimes chocolate almond milk!) because I think it makes them smoother. This is my favourite dessert ever. I would choose these brownies to be my last meal.
Awesome brownies! I didn’t know how much I’ve been missing them these past few years!
Great brownies but I had to bake them for over 45 minutes to cook all the way through. Would make again, though!

I am writing this for those also using gluten free flour...

Had to cook an additional 15 minutes until a toothpick came out clean. Just incase anyone else in gluten free

i love this!! this was my first time ever making brownies and i just recently turned vegan and was so so so surprised that this recipe turned out so well (im a horrible baker so i was kinda expecting burnt slop)! the brownies turned out really chewy and gooey
Awesome recipe. It was a bit crumbly though.

We made this following the recipe except substituting brown (cane) sugar for the white sugar since I don't eat white sugar as a vegan. Had to end up cooking it a bit longer than the recipe indicated as the middle was super gooey. But they came out fantastic, rich and chocolatey. All of my family loves them! So good!
Brownies have been our go-to bake during our isolation. We didn't have any eggs so this is what I found. These were good, however, these turned out to be more of a cake consistency than of brownies.
It was great! Usually I stand by my opinion that no vegan food is as good as the original, but these were just as great, if not better. And a plus, you can eat as much batter as you want! Thank you!!
these are perfect - i’m personally not vegan but can’t have many animal products that are in traditional desserts. instead of vegetable oil i did 4 tbsp of coconut oil

The texture of these brownies turned out PERFECTLY with crispy edges and a chewy moist inside. I followed the recipe exactly, but I used half oil and half apple sauce, and as one reviewer suggested I added the water first, then the apple sauce, then the oil. I also added 1 cup of chopped walnuts and half a cup of chocolate chips at the end. I will definitely make this again.

These brownies took a long time to bake and still were very raw and gooey. I 'm not sure if that is what the brownies are supposed to taste like but I didn't enjoy. I know it is vegan so it might not taste as good as brownies with eggs and butter but I still expected decently close to what I usually make. These tasted like they were made with nuts which I added none to and honestly it wasn't good at all. These reviews seemed good but I disagree.

Okay, what I realize is that many of these reviews with 5 stars have altered this recipe so significantly that it may as well have its own page. I, however, followed this one to a T and they did not turn out whatsoever. I baked them for 10 minutes longer than what is recommended and it turned out to be oily slop.
I have been using this recipe for about 5 years and it's the only one that ever works for me! I just swap the water for almond or soy milk and add chocolate chips if I have them!
Loved it! They were perfect. Added extra cocoa then 100% dark chocolate. They were delicious.
Very good! Substituted the oil with butter and water with milk for a creamier taste.

it's so tasteless. such a failure. i really don't know how others can be successful. 3/4 cup of cocoa powder with 2 cups of flour? the combination already sounds wrong but i saw all the good reviews and decided to go for it and failed miserably.

These were so so so good! HOWEVER i didnt have a tsp measuring cup for the salt, baking powder, and vanilla extract and used 1/2 a tbs instead (which is more) but they were SO GOOD. Im the only vegan and they were so surprised that it was egg and dairy-free. 10/10 would recommend.
this batter had way too much oil and my brownies never baked through even though i tried giving them extra baking time
Unbelievably amazing yumminess is all I can say. Love, love, love. Thank you!
Hard to take out if baking sheet but I think that’s just me lol and they are delicious!
Have made these 3 times & they are so YUMMY!! People didn’t even realize they were vegan!!! They are my go to when I need a dessert with little time to make one!!!
sprinkled some cacao powder on top

Just made my first batch. I baked them for 25mins and they were the perfect gooey texture. The edges were lightly crunchy. I subbed a half cup of White sugar with stevia and a half cup with brown sugar. In the future I’d make them with 1/8th cup or 1/4th cup less sugar because they were almost too sweet but all around pretty happy with them!!

I was looking for a quick, vegan brownie recipe and found this. I had baked as a last minute treat for an event, but sadly they are too crumbly to present. 

First off, I used 3/4 cup of sugar instead of 1 cup, which was perfect. I do this as standard practice as I have baked too many cakes, especially online recipes, which were sickly and way too sweet. 

I bake a fair few vegan cakes, biscuits, scones etc and noticed on making, that this recipe seems to call for way too much oil in my opinion, but gave it a go none the less. I now feel I should have reduced the oil to 3/4 cup. The rise was not as expected, the bake was much too dense due to the oil and the brownies did not hold together as they should after cutting. They were way too greasy and way too crumbly.

The texture in the mouth is somewhat claggy, rather than moist, but the flavour is spot on. They won't go to waste, we will eat them with custard or vegan ice cream, but in all honesty, this recipe needs tweaking!

I will either try again with less oil, or find another recipe.
Did not like the flavor

These were pretty bad. All I can taste is the oil. It’s all I can smell, too. I ended up adding frosting to the top and they still taste like oil. I will not make these again. Two stars because my kids are the

Have made dozens of times, both as posted and with some of the suggested subs (e.g. applesauce swap). Give to many omnivores, complete win.

I use chocolate chips (vegan) or other additions (Oreos, for example) to make them special. 

Note: my primary cooking audience IS NOT vegan. I am, but not the neighbors, friends, etc. that receive.

They gobble them up.

Great go-to.

These brownies are underrated! They were super easy to whip up and hands down the best brownies my family has ever tasted! 

PS they took about 10 minutes longer to bake in my oven than recipe instructed time, yet still super moist and gooey on the inside
I've made it 3 times and it is very good. A little soft, but the sweetness and richness make up for it. I made it with chocolate chips too, and that is good.
Made some traditional vegan upgrades.

I cannot tell you how many times I've made these brownies. They are awesome!! Even my non-vegan friends love them. Sometimes I make vegan buttercream frosting and too them off. You can add colored sugar or powdered cocoa powder to sprinkle on top Yum!!!!
I added natural organic maple syrup in addition to the sugar and it was still super bland. I would not recommend this recipe.
The consistency was nice, but the brownies were mild in chocolate flavor. Too mild for my taste. If you like fudgy brownies I'd suggest adding more cocoa powder.
Very delicious and can’t tell these are vegan brownies
Really good! Nice chocolate flavor and very moist.

The ingredients for this recipe are good. No substitutions are needed. The problem Reviewers encountered was the brownies were oily or the oil pooled in the brownie pan. Reading this recipe to my cousin who went to culinary school, she identified the problem. Since oil and water do not normally mix, the oil needs to be bound to something first before adding the water. Solution: Blend the sugar, oil, and cocoa powder first. Then, add the rest of the wet ingredients. Now the batter is ready for the addition of the salt, baking powder, and flour, in that order. Be sure to blend well after each addition of the dry ingredients. Another note: Be sure to line your 9x13 baking dish with parchment paper and spray well with nonstick spray. Now you’re ready to bake according to the Baker’s directions. The reason I gave this recipe 4 stars is because the directions weren’t as clear as they should be. However, after rectifying the oil issue, these brownies are chocolatey goodness. I will definitely make these again, should I come across another need for a vegan dessert.

This is my go-to recipe if I feel for a brownie that has no eggs or butter in it. It's delicious and hardly lasts a day at our house. It was a staple food while I was pregnant with my little one, as I struggled to digest animal products. That was over 2 years ago and I still pull it out at least once every 2-3 months.
This recipe was a very quick and easy way to make great brownies. I had to swap out the white flour for whole wheat flour cause thats all I had- and I added pecans. Super yummy!!!
I enjoy making these vegan brownies with my friends and the enjoy it as well as I do I'm glad to have found something vegan that they can enjoy too.
i added coconut oil instead of vegetable oil....made it thicker so put in a 1¾ cup of water ish to make it thin a bit

They are tasty. Very dense, rich and heavy. Didn't change anything. Mine were a bit under done and needed more time, my fault. Would love these with ice cream and maybe some berries or as a mix in for a shake. Yummy!
Great recipe for people with milk egg peanut or tree nut allergies (obviously omitting the optional topping). We use half dark cocoa powder and half regular and add dairy free chocolate chips
A bit to much oil.
i added coffee and 1/4 cup more cocoa powder. also try adding in vegan chocolate chips to make it gooey in the middle!

I've made this 4 times in the last 2 weeks and I appreciate how it's all pantry staples. The only changes I've made is I put a layer of vegan chocolate chips in the batter when I spread it in the pan and I sprinkle a little rainbow nonpareils on top. It is a solid, consistent recipe!
Delicious best vegan brownies my husband said i have made.
Excellent vegan brownie! And so easy to make!
These were so easy to make and the Vegans and non Vegans both loved them. It’s nice when you can find a dessert that everyone can enjoy. Thank you so much!!

Best brownies I've ever made, the only thing I changed was using almond milk in place of the water! Over all great recipe, and even better that it's vegan! I made theses for my non-vegan friends and they loved them, they were really shocked that they were animal product free!

okay so i will say the liquid measures are definitely off... i have a feeling they forgot to add milk or maybe just not enough water. it wouldnt even mix, it was like clay. but i added an extra 3/4 cups of water and the batter was so yummy! the cook time is also off, its been in for about 40 minutes and the center still isnt cooked. besides that, the batter is delicious and i cant wait until it comes out!
Delicious! Better than the box brownies by far - not just good for vegans but for everyone who thinks brownies are cool

I modified this recipe a bit. I used only 1 cup of sugar instead of 2 and 3/4 cup of oil instead of 1 and it turned out awesome. Pure awesome. I baked for 30 mins.
I'll try using less oil next time bc I don't think it's needed to use this much. The recipe was great though. Hubby and I loved it.

Like always, I read all reviews and suggestions first and adjusted the recipe to what I have in my pantry and fridge. So, instead of 1 cup of oil I used 1/2 cup each of oil and apple sauce. Instead of water I used 1 cup of coconut/almond milk. Also added 2 spoons of instant coffee to dry ingredients because I like strong chocolate flavor, and added chopped walnuts. I am not a professional in baking and it was my first time making any type of brownies, but it came out so, so delicious: cakey, gooey, soft. I just made the brownies and having a very hard keeping my family away from them, they keep picking at them. Thank you all!
I made these for my daughter and I had a hard time leaving them alone - they are unique and delicious. Now this is the recipe I will use whether cooking vegan or not.

Just eh. Made two batches; one as written and the other with applesauce subbed in for 1/2 of the oil. Rather flavorless and had a weird texture. I'll keep looking if i need something vegan in the future.
Amazing.....never would have guessed it didn’t have eggs in it. I added heath

These were really great! I was going to a party that was all vegan food and i had never made anything that was vegan so i was really nervous that it wouldn’t turn out well, but it did! I used brown sugar instead of white because I didn’t have any vegan white sugar! I will definitely make these again! My only two concerns were they were a little dry and very lumpy on the top other than that they were amazing!

These turned out great. I made them as the recipe says, but i added chocolate chips and walnuts. I also followed one reviewers advice and mixed the flour with water before adding the oil, so the gluten forms er whatever. 
Doing that though made it harder to mix and i was totally convinced half way through baking that it ruined the texture, but that wasn't the case! They are very gooey and moist, and hold together pretty good...for not having egg.
It was either not done being cooked or dry and i couldn't get it to be the in between so it'd be moist. (Do not recommend)

When I made these brownies, I replaced the oil with margarine. The only problem I had was that 1 cup of water was not enough liquid !! i had to add 2 cups of water to allow the mixture to be stirred. Other than that they tasted amazing and would definitely do them again :)

This recipe is FANTASTIC! These brownies are delicious and cheaper because NO EGGS! The taste is chocolatey, fudgy and decadent. Unless you mention it no one will know these are vegan. The taste is the same as non vegan brownies. To make them more cakey you would need to add a “little” more flour. A LITTLE (a couple of tablespoons maybe). To cook longer may be to overcook them but it’s your choice. Either way the taste is amazing. Highly recommend this recipe.
Great taste to these brownies, but they need wayyyy more bake time. They were brownie soup. They also had a crusty top which was interesting, not bad though

I read the reviews and used some apple sauce in place of the oil. I also put a little PAM in the pan. I feel bad because I am not sure my sugar was up to VEGAN par but I was not prepared to learn that not all white sugar is considered VEGAN. Everyone at the party, including the lone vegan, liked them. I am not vegan and so they were good but not sinful enough.

Great Vegan brownie recipe with minor adjustments...as per other reviews I too only used 1/2 cup of oil and 1-1/2 cups of water...and I had to omit vanilla because I was out. They are in between chewy and cake brownies which is great! I have tried many vegan brownie recipes and all were a gooey mess stuck to the pan but NOT this time!!! Thanks

I accidentally forgot to put in the cup of water and got very confused that the recipe would call for so little liquid, so I ended up using half a can of coconut milk instead to make it typical brownie consistency. The brownies were baked by the time I realised I needed water. They had to bake longer because of the mix up but they taste great with coconut milk substituted for water. Used the leftover milk in the can to make an icing with icing sugar and cocoa powder.
